spurt.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if liquid or flames spurt from something, they come out of it quickly and suddenly
spurt.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to send out liquid or flames quickly or suddenly
spurt.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: It boiled over, spurting hot water everywhere.
spurt.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to suddenly start moving more quickly, especially for a short time
spurt.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: He suddenly spurted ahead of the others.
spurt.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: when an amount of liquid or flame suddenly comes quickly out of something
spurt.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The water came out of the tap in short spurts  (=a small amount at a time).
spurt.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a short sudden increase of activity, effort, speed, or emotion
spurt.translation[1].definitions[1].note: growth spurt (=when a child suddenly grows quickly)
spurt.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: In a sudden spurt of anger, Ellen slammed the door shut.

spurt.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a short sudden increase of activity
spurt.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The stock market put on a spurt (=suddenly increased in activity for a short period of time) late in the day.
